author: Timothy Linward
description:
Ever since Games Workshop and Amazon announced they were teaming up to create an official Warhammer 40k TV series, with Henry Cavill in a starring role, I’ve been equally eager and apprehensive. How can a TV studio bring the insane scale of conflict in the 41st millennium to life, without blowing through its whole budget in the intro cinematic? A new animation, available via the Warhammer TV subscription service, offers many answers.

Continue reading New Warhammer 40k animation shows how the Henry Cavill TV series could work
MORE FROM WARGAMER: Best Warhammer 40k starter sets, Best Warhammer 40k games, All Warhammer 40k factions<
title: New Warhammer 40k animation shows how the Henry Cavill TV series could work

author: Timothy Linward
description:
The Ewoks are both the cutest, and most disturbing, part of the original Star Wars trilogy - a tribal society of furry teddy bears who cook and eat sentient creatures, and successfully fight back against Imperial Stormtroopers with basic spears and guerrilla tactics. This amazing custom army for Star Wars Legion is the work of Minis For War Commission painting studio, and it ramps up the cognitive dissonance even further by turning the violent teddies into brightly colored Care Bears!

Continue reading This eye-popping Ewok army for Star Wars Legion is a force of lethal Care Bears
MORE FROM WARGAMER: Best Star Wars board games, Star Wars Legion - release dates roadmap,
title: This eye-popping Ewok army for Star Wars Legion is a force of lethal Care Bears

author: Mollie Russell
description:
Dungeons and Dragons’ playtest content is material that needs more work before it can be published. Heck, many Unearthed Arcana ideas don’t even make it past the playtesting stages. What I’m trying to say is that, when a new playtest document seems wildly out of balance, we should be a little forgiving. Emphasis on the little, though, because this new Psion playtest is seriously wonky.

Continue reading One new DnD Psion subclass is so much better than the rest, it's embarrassing
MORE FROM WARGAMER: DnD 2024 Player's Handbook review, DnD classes guide, DnD races guide
title: One new DnD Psion subclass is so much better than the rest, it's embarrassing

author: Timothy Linward
description:
The US Court of International Trade has judged that there is no basis in American law for many of the Trump administration’s tariff orders, effectively eliminating them. This will be welcome, but possibly temporary, relief for the US board games industry, where business leaders have predicted ruin since unprecedented tariffs were first levied on Chinese imports.

Continue reading Board game industry doomsday delayed as trade court blocks Trump tariffs
MORE FROM WARGAMER: Best board games , Couples' board games, Board games for adults
title: Board game industry doomsday delayed as trade court blocks Trump tariffs

author: Callum Self
description:
The heat of the sun burning into your skin, the Sandworms keen to eat you at a moment’s notice, and the constant political tension are just three reasons why I’d never personally go to Arrakis. If you’re keen to see whether you could survive the torturous sands of this brilliant sci-fi world, the tabletop RPG Dune: Adventures in the Imperium is a great experience. And right now you can get 17 RPG books from the game at a massive discount, thanks to Fanatical’s latest bundle.

Continue reading Before Dune Awakening, grab a big discount on this huge tabletop RPG bundle
title: Before Dune Awakening, grab a big discount on this huge tabletop RPG bundle

author: Timothy Linward
description:
Time to update your apps! Pokémon Pocket’s newest set, Extradimensional Crisis, launched on Thursday, bringing with it 103 new cards for deck brewers to tinker with. We’ve picked the five we think have the most potential to make a big showing in the meta.

Continue reading Five powerhouse cards to watch in Pokémon TCG Pocket Extradimensional Crisis
MORE FROM WARGAMER: How many Pokémon are there?, How to play Pokémon cards, Rare Pokémon cards
title: Five powerhouse cards to watch in Pokémon TCG Pocket Extradimensional Crisis

author: Matt Bassil
description:
The Magic: The Gathering card Arwen, Mortal Queen is ramping up in value. This Lord of the Rings mythic rare was pretty darn cheap 10 days ago, costing only $2.20 for the basic version by MTG Goldfish’s reckoning. But in that time its price has more than doubled, and a copy now goes for $5.50.

Continue reading MTG Lord of the Rings card that's fire in a Final Fantasy deck spikes 150%
MORE FROM WARGAMER: All MTG sets in order, Upcoming MTG release dates, How to play MTG
title: MTG Lord of the Rings card that's fire in a Final Fantasy deck spikes 150%
